markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Air Repeater](/Weapons.aspx?ID=188)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Agile" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=170" />
<trait label="Repeating" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=374" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 152</row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society)  Gunslingers (and characters with the Gunslinger archetype) gain access to all uncommon weapons, ammunition, and related items from Chapter 4 of this book, with the exception of Beast Guns and any limited or restricted items, unless the item indicates otherwise. Characters with a Home Region of Arcadia have access to air guns, non-black powder ammunition and accessories._

**Access**  The following regions have access to firearms: Alkenstar, Dongun Hold, Tian Xia, Vudra, Arcadia, Ustalav, the Shackles

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 5 gp

**Damage** 1d4 P

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

**Range** 30 ft.

**Reload** 0
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Simple

**Group** [Firearm](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=16)
</row>

**Ammunition** [Magazine (Air Repeater)](/Weapons.aspx?ID=209)

</column>

---

A thin-barreled firearm that uses a container of pressurized air instead of black powder to propel small metal bullets from an attached cartridge, the air repeater has fallen out of common use in Arcadia due to its poor stopping power, though it's still used occasionally for casual hunting and sport shooting. The air repeater and its longer-ranged, two-handed variant are still valued by some for their ability to allow a shooter to fire multiple rounds without needing to stop to reload or crank to a new chamber. A typical air repeater magazine holds 6 pellets.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-16" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Weapons</title>
[Dezullon Fountain](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1883)
